content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Count & Layers
- Total blocks used: 6 blocks
- Layers: 2 layers
  - Bottom layer: 2 red arch blocks
  - Top layer: 2 yellow tall blocks and 2 green rectangular blocks

## Spatial Relationships
- The bottom layer consists of two red arch blocks placed side by side horizontally, forming a structure with two arches
- The top layer has 4 blocks standing vertically on top of the bottom layer:
  - Two tall yellow rectangular blocks positioned at the back, one on the left side and one on the right side
  - Two green rectangular blocks positioned in front of the yellow blocks, one on the left side and one on the right side

# Required Blocks from the Dictionary

Based on my analysis of the target structure, the following blocks from the dictionary are needed:

1. Red arch blocks: Block indices 1 and 2 (for the bottom layer)
2. Green rectangular blocks: Block indices 10 and 10 (for the top layer)
3. Yellow tall blocks: Block indices 14 and 15 (for the top layer)

# Assembly Order

```
{
  Step1: Move block with index 1
  Step2: Move block with index 2
  Step3: Move block with index 14
  Step4: Move block with index 10
  Step5: Move block with index 15
  Step6: Move block with index 10
}
```

This assembly sequence starts with the bottom layer (the two red arch blocks side by side), followed by adding the blocks in the top layer from left to right (yellow tall block, green rectangular block, yellow tall block, green rectangular block).
